div.head: Capitulum 8
Quod remedium illi habuerunt, qui fuerunt ante circumcisionem.
div.p: But it is asked about the men, who lived before circumcision, and about the women, who where before and after, whether they had a remedy against sin.

Some say, that sacrifices and oblations were valid for them for the remission of sin. But it is better to say that, those who come from Abraham, were justified through circumcision; but women are justified through faith and good work, either their own, if they were adults, or of their parents, if they were children: but those who were children before circumcision were justified through the faith of their parents. But parents were justified through the power of sacrifices, namely justified through what they understood spiritually in those sacrifices.

Whence
Gregory :
What is valid among us through the water of baptism, this occurred among the old ones or for their children only through faith, or for great sins through the power of sacrifice, or for those who come from the stock of Abraham, through the mystery of circumcision.
Gregorius, Moralia, IV, c. 3 .
